alert.note: Alert for Clay; Cloud; Republic; Washington (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 10:41PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Republic, northern Clay, southwestern Washington and eastern Cloud Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1040 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southwest of Agenda to 4 miles southeast of Aurora. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Washington, Clyde, Clifton, Miltonvale, Linn, Morganville, Morrowville, Palmer, Agenda, Aurora and Vining. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for north central Kansas.
